result.execSummary:
The deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael James Breeden is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:35 AM   CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. ADA: Bela Alexander Ballo, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Michael James Breeden appeared. Court reviews case. Atty Harrelson updates court on payments. ADA Ballo notes there is a motion to dismiss and notes Court needed tax intercepts for 2019 and 2020. Atty Harrelson states the DE has been making payments to CSA. Atty Harrelson states there is still interest on arrears owed. Court notes if he gets a no objection from Mr. Wolske he will dismiss case. ADA Ballo approved ex parte communication. Court dismiss case without prejudice on receipt of verification Adjourned 11:43 PM
Hearing on December 2, 2021 at 11:15 am.
JA left Def. a voicemail to inform today's hearing was off. Atty. Harrelson is out of the office for two weeks. RJG

02:53 PM  CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: K Kittel.  DA:  Karl E Anderson   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Michael James Breeden appeared. Atty Anderson makes statements regarding 10/14/20 hearing. Atty Harrelson responds. Court requires documentation as to proof of tax intercetion to go towards arrears. If that proof is provided, court will likely dismiss the revocation. Court will set 60 day I/R to check status. Adjourned at 3:00 pm
Status conference on June 4, 2021 at 02:45 pm.

02:31 PM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Brian Thomas Smestad   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Michael James Breeden appeared. Lisa of Diversion appeared. Karn of VW appeared. Set for MH. ADA Smestad states motion to dismiss filed to dismiss motion for revocation. ADA Smestad states Defendant has been making payments towards arrears and current obligation and isn't seeking to revoke diversion. Atty Harrelson supports the request for dismissal and responds. Court questions attys. Court cannot proceed any further today and advises attys to listen to 10/14/20 hearing. Court sets STC in person. Defendant confirms physical address, mailing address, and phone number. Adjourned at 2:50 PM.  gll  Status conference scheduled for June 4, 2021 at 02:45 pm.

01:12  PM  CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: K Kittel.   ADA:  Karl E Anderson   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Michael James Breeden appeared.  Court reviews case. Atty Anderson notes DJOC for support. This DJOC said DE had to pay all of the arrears and notes that it would take an additional five years to become current and moves to dismiss. Atty Anderson feels there should be another hearing to allow victim to be present if necessary. Atty Harrelson has no objection, however wants to know that victims rights were complied with and asks that his client be allowed to appear via zoom.  Court will set another hearing, Approved. Attys are to be prepared to answer as to the full amount of arrears and the total amounts paid. Adjourned at  Motion hearing scheduled for April 14, 2021 at 08:30 am.

10:07 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:   Karl E Anderson, NONA by def. Attorney Rohl appears on behalg of St. Croix County Child Support. Set for Review Hearing. Court reviews file. Defendant was $70 short for April payment towards current child support obligation and nothing towards arrears. Atty Rohl also states that an involuntary payment of just shy of $1500 was made in May. Current arrears are $15,541.92. ADA Anderson intends to file motion to revoke. Court extends diversion agreement, pending possible revocation, until all past-due obligations are paid in full. Court issues body-only warrant statewide.  gll
Review hearing on October 14, 2020 at 10:00 am.

11:22 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. ADA:  Karl E Anderson        Michael James Breeden pro se. Court reviews file. DE had a medical emergency and wasn't able to make the last hearing. Court extends diversion agreement until 12/1/20 or until Defendant has paid all past-due obligations. DE states he can't make the payments. ADA Anderson updates the Court regarding payments. ADA Anderson requests review hearing at the end of this year and doesn't object to DE appearing by phone, as long as DE is making payments. DE to provide updated physical address when known. DE confirms address and updates phone number.  gll  Review hearing scheduled for October 14, 2020 at 10:00 am.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton   DF:  Michael James Breeden appeared from jail. P. Dabruzzi in court with Atty Rohl. Includes 08FA502 and 15CF301. Case called at 11:18 am. Court reviews files. There is an agreement on 15CF301. ADA Kelly recites. No objection from Atty Caton. Atty Rohl makes statement. Is recommending remaining jail time to be stayed in 08FA502. Def to signed pre-signed waiver of extradiation. On 15CF301, Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count one. Atty Caton makes statement.  Court withholds entering conviction in favor of Diversion Agreement. Charges to two, three and four are dismissed. The state will prepare pre-signed waiver of extradiation. On 08FA502, Court reaffirms finding of contempt. Court stays remaining 95 Days. Def to remain current for one year. Court amends bond on 15CF301.  Probation review hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-09-2015 11:15 am
